intro: Maba venosa, commonly known as the veined maba, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive veined leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. The flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers present on the same plant.
